intro: Parosela capitata, commonly known as the clustered parosela, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Parosela capitata is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth.
